Emerging growth company &#168; &#160; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act. &#168; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; Item&#160;5.07 Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders. &#160; At Tesla, Inc.&#8217;s (&#8220; Tesla &#8221;) 2024 Annual Meeting of Stockholders (the &#8220; Annual Meeting &#8221;) held on June 13, 2024, Tesla&#8217;s stockholders voted on the following twelve proposals and Tesla&#8217;s inspector of election certified the vote tabulations indicated below . &#160; Proposal 1 &#160; The individuals listed below were elected as Class II directors at the Annual Meeting to serve on Tesla&#8217;s Board of Directors (&#8220; Board &#8221;) for a term of three years or until their respective successors are duly elected and qualified. &#160; &#160; &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Votes James Murdoch &#160; 1,568,468,453 &#160; 710,657,343 &#160; 31,143,094 &#160; 335,111,943 Kimbal Musk &#160; 1,814,064,783 &#160; 468,987,640 &#160; 27,216,467 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; Proposal 2 &#160; Proposal 2 was a management proposal to approve executive compensation on a non-binding advisory basis. This proposal was approved. &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Votes 1,834,794,743 &#160; 449,639,303 &#160; 25,834,844 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; Proposal 3 &#160; Proposal 3 was a management proposal to approve the redomestication of Tesla from Delaware to Texas by conversion. This proposal was approved. Approval of the proposal required the affirmative vote of each of: &#160; &#183; the majority of outstanding shares of Tesla common stock entitled to vote on the proposal (the &#8220; Conversion Standard &#8221;), &#160; and &#160; &#183; the majority of the total votes of shares of Tesla common stock not owned, directly or indirectly, by Elon Musk or Kimbal Musk, represented in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal (the &#8220; Conversion Disinterested Standard &#8221;). &#160; The results of the stockholder vote are reported below: &#160; (1) Pursuant to the Conversion Standard, the votes were as follows: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Votes 2,000,873,803 &#160; 293,910,071 &#160; 15,485,016 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; Accordingly, the votes cast in favor of approving Proposal 3 constituted approximately 63% of outstanding shares of Tesla common stock entitled to vote on the proposal. &#160; (2) &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; Pursuant to the Conversion Disinterested Standard, the votes were as follows: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Votes 1,588,203,007 &#160; 293,910,071 &#160; 15,485,016 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; Accordingly, the votes cast in favor of approving Proposal 3 constituted approximately 84% of the total votes of shares of Tesla common stock not owned, directly or indirectly, by Elon Musk or Kimbal Musk, represented in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal. &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; Proposal 4 &#160; Proposal 4 was a management proposal to ratify the 100% performance-based stock option award to Elon Musk that was proposed to and approved by our stockholders in 2018. This proposal was approved. Approval of the proposal required the affirmative vote of each of: &#160; &#183; the majority of the total votes of shares of Tesla common stock cast in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting on the proposal, pursuant to the rules of The Nasdaq Stock Market LLC (the &#8220; NASDAQ Standard &#8221;), &#160; &#160; &#160; and &#160; &#160; &#183; the majority of the voting power of the shares present in person or represented by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal, pursuant to Tesla&#8217;s amended and restated bylaws (the &#8220; Bylaws Standard &#8221;), &#160; &#160; &#160; and &#160; &#160; &#183; the majority of the total votes of shares of Tesla common stock not owned, directly or indirectly, by Elon Musk or Kimbal Musk, cast in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting on the proposal, pursuant to the resolutions of the Board of Directors of Tesla (the &#8220; Ratification Disinterested Standard &#8221;). &#160; The results of the stockholder vote are reported below: &#160; (1) Pursuant to the NASDAQ Standard, the votes were as follows: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Broker Non-Votes 1,760,780,650 &#160; 528,908,419 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; Accordingly, the votes cast in favor of approving Proposal 4 constituted approximately 77% of the total votes of shares of Tesla common stock cast in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting on the proposal. &#160; (2) Pursuant to the Bylaws Standard, the votes were as follows: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Votes 1,760,780,650 &#160; 528,908,419 &#160; 20,579,821 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; Accordingly, the votes cast in favor of approving Proposal 4 constituted approximately 76% of the voting power of the shares present in person or represented by proxy at the Annual Meeting and entitled to vote on the proposal. &#160; (3) Pursuant to the Ratification Disinterested Standard, the votes were as follows: &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Broker Non-Votes 1,348,109,854 &#160; 528,908,419 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; Accordingly, the votes cast in factor of approving Proposal 4 constituted approximately 72% of all votes cast in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting on the proposal, excluding votes of shares owned, directly or indirectly, by Messrs. Elon and Kimbal Musk. &#160; Proposal 5 &#160; Proposal 5 was a management proposal to ratify the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Company&#8217;s independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2024. This proposal was approved. &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Votes 2,545,112,670 &#160; 66,178,057 &#160; 34,090,106 &#160; 0 &#160; Proposal 6 &#160; Proposal 6 was a non-binding advisory stockholder proposal regarding reduction of director terms to one year. This proposal was approved. &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Votes 1,231,680,337 &#160; 1,044,766,276 &#160; 33,822,277 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; Proposal 7 &#160; Proposal 7 was a non-binding advisory stockholder proposal regarding simple majority voting provisions in our governing documents. This proposal was approved. &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Votes 1,225,968,057 &#160; 1,047,335,839 &#160; 36,964,994 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; Proposal 8 &#160; Proposal 8 was a non-binding advisory stockholder proposal regarding annual reporting on anti-harassment and discrimination efforts. This proposal was not approved. &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Votes 712,788,260 &#160; 1,547,103,308 &#160; 50,377,322 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; Proposal 9 &#160; Proposal 9 was a non-binding advisory stockholder proposal regarding adoption of a freedom of association and collective bargaining policy. This proposal was not approved. &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Votes 462,903,318 &#160; 1,783,899,772 &#160; 63,465,800 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; Proposal 10 &#160; Proposal 10 was a non-binding advisory stockholder proposal regarding reporting on effects and risks associated with electromagnetic radiation and wireless technologies. This proposal was not approved. &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Votes 84,116,666 &#160; 2,156,432,223 &#160; 69,720,001 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; Proposal 11 &#160; Proposal 11 was a non-binding advisory stockholder proposal regarding adopting targets and reporting on metrics to assess the feasibility of integrating sustainability metrics into senior executive compensation plans. This proposal was not approved. &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Votes 229,393,871 &#160; 2,025,404,233 &#160; 55,470,786 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; Proposal 12 &#160; Proposal 12 was a non-binding advisory stockholder proposal regarding committing to a moratorium on sourcing minerals from deep sea mining. This proposal was not approved. &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Votes 172,864,517 &#160; 2,071,493,645 &#160; 65,910,728 &#160; 335,111,943 &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; SIGNATURES &#160; Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned hereunto duly authorized. &#160; &#160; &#160; TESLA, INC. &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; By: /s/Brandon Ehrhart &#160; &#160; Brandon Ehrhart General Counsel and Corporate Secretary &#160; Date: June 14, 2024 &#160; &#160;
